author: Staff Reporter
text:
Elderly women, widows, single women and destitute had submitted a memorandum seeking financial assistance through the Department of Women and Child Development on December 31, 2015.

Based on the request, Chief Minister N. Rangasamy had decided to provide the financial assistance to 14,500 beneficiaries. Following which, 648 from Kathirkamam, 597 from Indiranagar constituency, 89 from Thattanchavady and 618 beneficiaries from Muthialpet were provided financial assistance of Rs 32,85,000 in total on Saturday.

For the 9750 beneficiaries from 19 constituencies, financial assistance of Rs 1,58,92,000 would be provided between February 14 to 20. For 2170 women beneficiaries in the five constituencies of Karikal, Rs 37,48,000 would be provided between February 14 to 20.

A total amount of Rs 3,47,500 and Rs 6,70,500 are allocated to the 198 and 440 beneficiaries in Yanam and Mahe respectively. A total of Rs 2,39,44,000 would be spent to provide financial assistance to the women.
title: Elderly women, widows get assistance
